result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Westin Duane Smith in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls 16CM38, 15CM44, 16CM80 and 16CM56.  DEJ presented to court.  Def pleads NC to counts in DEJ.  No coercion.  Court accepts DEJ.  Def asks court to sign.  Court signs DEJ.  Adj.  klr

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls 16CM80,38,56 and 15CM44.  Def does not appear.  Was scheduled for 1:45 and is now 2:05.  DA requests warrant be authorized.  Court authorizes warrant at DA's discretion.  klr
Status conference on December 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 4, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Westin Duane Smith in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases.  Attorney Crawford has filed withdrawal.  Public Defender given again to def and told to contact.  DA requests 30 day adjournment.  Bond to continue.  No contact provision reinforced by court.  10:44, back on record:  Defendant now appears with attorney Joseph Hoffmann as qualifies for PD.  Appearances cited again.  DA requeests 30-day adjournment.  Hoffmann notes to court this is a special appearance.  To come back on Sept. 6th.  Bond to continue.  To be scheduled for 9/6.  klr
to Withdraw as attorney-Granted by Court.

Defendant Westin Duane Smith in court.  Martin J. Lipske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Joseph Crawford is attorney of record in other cases.  Def has August 18th date on other cases so PTC in this case to be set at same time.  NG plea to be entered on def's behalf.  Court will appoint Crawford in not qualified for Public Def.  Bond continues per court.

Defendant Westin Duane Smith in court, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases.  Gives background.  Public defender information given.  Additional charges coming.  DA requests $1,000 cash bond and court sets as requested.  Defendant is told to contact the public defender.  Attorney Crawford may be able to be appointed.  klr
